`combine_smr`
<br>
<br>

<h4 style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">About</h4>
<ul class="breadcrumb" style="background-color:#fff; border:none; color:#3e3f3a">

  <li><a href="#Value">Value</a></li>

<h4 style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Description</h4>

This function combines several analyzed .csv data files to create one continuous file for final analysis with the `MMR_SMR_AS_EPOC` function. 

<h4><a style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left" name="Arguments">Arguments</a></h4>

  Argument       | Description | Default
---: | :------------- | :---
**smr_files**   | The names of data files that need to be combined. A character vector. The used files should be the export files from the `SMR` function, with the name tag “(…)_analyzed.csv”. More than two files can be combined. | --
**date_format** | The date format used in the original FireSting files. Must specify one of the following: `"m/d/y"`, `"d/m/y"`, `"y-m-d"`, and must be consistent across the files | `"m/d/y"`
**path**        | Working directory for newly created data files. Two options: i) local directory (the default), and ii) the “../../MMR_SMR_AS_EPOC/input_files”, which only works if the `organize_MR_analysis` function was used and if the currently set working directory is “(…)/AUTO/csv_analyzed”   | `"."` (local directory)

<br><h4><a name="Value" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Value</a></h4>

<h5 style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left; text-indent:+10px;"><i class="fas fa-ellipsis-h"></i>&nbsp; Data outputs</h5>

**”.csv files”**

  - The combined file with a new name tag: "(…)_GLUED_nX.csv", where X = the N of files. 
  - The combined file is on a continuous timescale and starts with relative time “0”.

<br><h4><a name="Details" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Details</a></h4> <br>

The output can be directly used in the MMR_SMR_AS_EPOC function. The original files used to create combined files are unchanged.

<br><h4><a name="Example" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Example</a></h4> <br>

<pre class = "sourceCode yaml"> 
# any n files will combine. 

combine_smr(smr_files=c("anyfile_smr1_mgO2L_analyzed.csv",
                        "anyfile_smr2_mgO2L_analyzed.csv"),
            date_format = "m/d/y")
</pre>
